website_summaries.verdict: Packing a lot of viewing power in a relatively lightweight housing, this is a go-to spotting scope for hunters, target shooters, and birdwatchers.
pros: Nicely balanced for its size and weight, which is fairly light
Perfect field of view for target shooting
Crystal-clear detail focus on targets, allowing a clear view of shot groups
Long-distance viewing is no problem for this scope
cons: Tripod mounting screw has plastic threads that can be easily stripped
Image isn’t very bright in low-light conditions or indoors

customer_reviews.title: Prism delaminated!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Roxant Blackbird for target spotting and recreational bird watching from our porch. It lasted for just over one year of casual use. No hiking or camping.....just sitting on our porch. At this price point I did not expect $300 optics. In fact, the optics were pretty good. Then one day it became hard to focus and within a week I couldn't see anything through it. I could here something rattling around when I handled it. The optic prism had come loose. I can't recommend this spotting scope. seems cheaply made, to me.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: The focus on this one left a lot to be desired
customer_reviews.text: My wife got this for me as an early Christmas gift. I am a hunter safety instructor and felt this would be good for the range. The focus on this scope was impossible to use, way too lose. It was so touchy that is was always over, or under focus. It almost seemed as if i received a used unit. I returned it for refund immediately. We purchased this mainly due to the good reviews. ... Not so much!
customer_reviews.author: KenOcala

customer_reviews.title: Great scope without paying premium price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this scope primarily for shooting on the 100 ya range. Very good scope for the money. My wife likes to use it at night looking at the moon on clear nights, not it’s intended use on my part. Lol. Scope feels rugged and if dropped I’m not worried about it being easily broken due to the rubber armor coating. Comes with an all metal tripod and metal screw. Not a plastic rig which is a plus. Very light weight and goes easily in my range bag. Thus far very pleased with the Blackbird and it didn’t break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: J. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Great scope
customer_reviews.text: The Blackbird spotting scope is a wonderful product. Small, so it's easy to transport, the build quality seems good, the attached lens and eyepiece covers are a real plus, and the tripod is very sturdy. The optics are sharp and the zoom and focus features are smooth and precise. The scope's main use for us is bird and wildlife watching. I've looked at other scopes on the market but this one cannot be beat for the price and the features such as the retractable lens hood, the tripod and the carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a spotting score to help me zero my equipment when at the range. The scope seems to be constructed well. The tripod is study and keeps the scope stable while in use. The scope itself does a great job in letting my view where my shots are going. Haven't yet tested it at a far distance at an outdoor range. Will do that later on this summer. What I enjoy the most is the value I got for the price. I needed an affordable scope that does the job well that wasn't expensive. The Blackbird does that. I will be recommending this product to other shooters that are looking for the same thing I was.
customer_reviews.author: LCL1966

customer_reviews.title: Great for Birding
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with our purchase of the Roxant Authentic Blackbird High Definition Spotting Scope with Zoom. As participants in a study of the American Kestrel (Falco sparverius) in our area, we needed a small, highly portable spotting scope. The Roxant Blackbird is perfect for the job. The Blackbird is lightweight, easy to use, and reasonably priced. Magnification, focus and zoom are very good for a scope of this size. The attached lens caps are a great touch and are extremely convenient. The included tabletop tripod is a nice addition and would be useful when shooting from a bench at the rifle range but we prefer using a full-sized tripod in the field.
customer_reviews.author: NAA60512

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lightweight scope
customer_reviews.text: I live on the Columbia River in Washington State and wanted a spotting scope to watch the wildlife, mountains, shipping and boating traffic. The Blackbird scope serves my needs very well. With very little practice I have learned to find objects to view quickly and focus on them. The scope is light, sturdy and easy to transport from our Family Room to the outside deck. I place the scope with tripod on a small table in front of a comfortable chair on the deck and have enjoyed many hours of pleasurable viewing. Before purchase, I compared the price I paid for the Blackbird to other telescopes in local stores. I feel the Blackbird was the best value for my money
customer_reviews.author: Lilly Brock

customer_reviews.title: OMG. Where'd the target go?
customer_reviews.text: I liked being able to see the bullet holes in a standard hunting target at 100 yards at the range with this, but at that distance, acquiring the target in the first place is very frustrating and once you do, any kind of contact with the scope/tripod or what they're sitting on throws it off and you have to hunt for the target again. I can't use this for objects past 50 yards because of this. I already have a hand-held monocular that can acquire the target real quick at 50 yards and see the bullet holes as well. I may have to lug my big spotting scope for 75 and 100 yards.
customer_reviews.author: D. L.

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for any money
customer_reviews.text: This scope is so much clearer than other scopes in the price range. I have already bought several and returned them. I will not be returning this one. I will be using it to shoot at 100yds and have no doubt it will meet and exceed my needs. The clarity and build quality can't be matched by anything close to the price. Weight and rubber armor are awesome. Focus ring is smooth. It was also easy to figure out and use. Hope it holds up well but if not have a great customer service policy to take advantage of. Really can't wait to get out and do some real testing on the scope.
customer_reviews.author: Krism

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product!
customer_reviews.text: I gave the scope as a gift to my father for Christmas. He’d requested a different scope but I went with this one after reading the description and reviews and boy am I glad I did. My father LOVES it. He said it was super easy to set up and the angle of it makes it easy to hold. It’s a great product! He plans to use it when they go to watch the eagles at Shiloh but he’s already used it for spotting birds in our neighborhood. The weight of it is perfect as well. He said his hand doesn’t get tired quickly with it which is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Logan

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS SCOPE!!!
customer_reviews.text: GOOD HOLY MOTHER OF GOD, THIS THING IS AWESOME! Tried it out as soon as I got it, could read street signs and license plates, point out knots in the telephone poles, pick out individual leaves on trees FROM 6 BLOCKS AWAY, CLEAR AS DAY! I plan on using this for shot calling for long range precision shooting, was hesitant because of the price, but d@mn am I glad I went with this one! The only thing that might kill it if it doesn't hold up, so here's hoping, thoroughly blown away thus far though! Glass quality is up there with Vortex! If I could give 10 stars, I would!
customer_reviews.author: Kai Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Scope for the Quality and Price
customer_reviews.text: I am new to using spotting scopes and conducted months of research to determine what scope would be the best for me. I chose the Roxant Blackbird for several reasons: 1. Quality objective lense. Although initially I preferred an 80mm lense rather than the Blackbird’s 50mm lense, I had learned of possible image distortion with a larger objective lense of lesser quality. 2. Lightweight and portable for use at home or outdoors. 3. Price. The price is extraordinary for the value. 4. Ease of use. After several days of use, I realized, beginner or not, the Roxant Blackbird, is perfect for my interests of watching birds, and the beach and ocean activity of humans and animals.
customer_reviews.author: DMZ

customer_reviews.title: A Great Value
customer_reviews.text: As a small bore pistol target shooter, I use the Blackbird for two applications; 25' slow fire air pistol and 25 yard slow fire rimfire pistol. For both applications, the Blackbird performs exceptionally well. Most indoor ranges are dim at the 25 yard line and the scope captures enough light to give crisp lines perfect for scoring. The degree of zoom and ability to easily focus are well suited for my use. The tripod is sturdy and necessary for my use. The velcro straps on the outside of the scope case are a nice touch so I can keep the two items together. I highly recommend this product for its overall value and features.
customer_reviews.author: Mountaineer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Scope
customer_reviews.text: I just received the scope today. I set it up and it meets my expectations and then some. I'm impressed so far. I plan on using it at the gun range. Nice size and weight. Tripod seems sturdy. My granddaughter wants to use it to look at the moon and stars The instructions were good. the videos on the website were great. Price seems fair.I assumed the Velcro straps on the case were for the tripod. If so they are a bit short but after running them under one leg they work fine. The shade was a bit stiff at first but seemed to loosen up after repeated use. Overall very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Value and quality all wrapped up in a convenient package.  Ideal for the range bag.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for shooters/hunters or bird watchers. Compact and lightweight enough for extended hikes and forays into the woods. It looks and feels great. I plan to use it sighting in my rifles out to about 150+ yards. It's an ideal size for my range bag. Feels hefty enough to withstand recoil vibration and not lose focus. Scope feels sturdy and construction is solid. Rubber armor casing great . Focus ring moves nicely, smooth and steady and gives the impression that any bench recoil vibration will not alter focus. Tripod very sturdy. With Scope attached, sits down clean and level. Other scopes with the BAK-4 Prism are much more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: John Franks

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Economy priced spotting scope. When I got it, I was super impressed with it. Then I looked through some nicer scopes... The way the tripod attaches to the case is a little flimsy but it works. On a long hike I couldn’t get it comfortable with the case around my shoulder so I just stashed it in my bag. It’s appropriately priced and works well enough for the amateur or novice shooter/bird watcher. If you’re more serious about the activity you are buying it for, I would recommend something higher quality. For use at the range, it’s adequate at 100 yards but not 200.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Switzer

customer_reviews.title: More Than I Expected
customer_reviews.text: Even in my short ownership of my Blackbird, I LOVE IT!!! I was having trouble seeing the targets I was shooting at and could not tell if my rounds were zero’ed-in. With this Roxant I can now tell precisely where each round goes and my spotter can help me adjust while shooting. It saves ammunition...which is at a premium these days. I really like the wonderful Focus Ring that allows me NOT to have to re-don my glasses. Additionally, on sunny days the Sun Shade has been a life saver. It has solved so many issues.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice spotting scope! It is very clear at distance. The tripod is sturdy and does well on a shooting stand. I agree with and can confirm all of the positive feedback I saw before I purchased this scope. And am glad I purchased it over the 'Best Seller'. The Seller does a great job in following up. They are genuinely interested in making sure that this scope is right for me in every way. I'll be buying a second one for my son soon. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Youdog99

customer_reviews.title: Spotting Scope, small but sharp.
customer_reviews.text: First the intended use, we have a friend with a condo on the water. The scope is helpful in checking out the variety of boats and ships passing by during the day. We see everything from day cruisers to cargo ships. At night the moon and stars are the subject. The scope itself is very small but very sharp. Focus is easy and the entire rig with tripod is light but not so light as to be cheap feeling. The price is fair and the scope is worth that cost. It’s new, so we have no idea how it will hold up. I suspect it will be just fine in reasonable conditions and with reasonable care.
customer_reviews.author: PHL2PBI

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product, best customer service I have ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I recently became interested in birding that's what I will be using the Blackbird scope for, I also purchased an adapter to hook up my cell phone to the scope. Got some bird food on the way and will start photographing in my backyard, as soon as I get the adapter. The Blackbird's rubber casing makes it really friendly and secure when handling. The tripod is very sturdy and holds the scope quite securely. The included instructions are very helpful, easy to understand and follow. For what they’re offering the price is more than fair. This would make a great gift idea for anyone interested in using a spotting scope. I would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: John Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Better than advertised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Blackbird in order to better identify wildlife, including deer, on my property. After unboxing it, I was immediately impressed with how stout it felt. We have a rule at our house...if it isn't heavy duty, it doesn't come home. The Blackbird passes the test. I really like the rubberized coating. The tripod is sturdy and easy to use. Most importantly, the lenses are incredibly crisp and clear. I took it to work to show my friend and I'm sure he will be ordering one. On another note, I really enjoy supporting small companies. I get the feeling that Roxant really cares.
customer_reviews.author: Jil

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This scope is easy to use and very powerful. There is rubber grip for holding the scope or a nice tripod for setting it up for hands free operation. This scope feels well made and the tripod also seems sturdy. Included is a nice carrying bag for the scope one and the tripod can be attached for convient carrying too. This was an early Christmas gift, and it was loved. This will be a great scope for target practice, hunting, as well as useful in trail riding as you can use the scope to see very clearly for over 10 miles. It is an amazing unit!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dmp

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and Quality built
customer_reviews.text: I’m very pleased with the purchase. The scope is light, compact (easily fits in my range bag), and seems to be a very solid design with smooth functions for adjustment and focus. I very much like the rubber armor, and as stated above the function rings are quiet and smooth to the feel. Feels like quality workmanship. The tripod is sturdy and easily deployed. My primary use will be checking hits at the shooting range, but I’ll also use in the deer stand checking out the size of the racks, and in just glassing the hills and valleys for game.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Phipps

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice sturdy scope
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice sturdy scope, especially for the price. I use it for Tactical Rifle Range shooting for targets 100+ yards. It fits nicely in my range bag. The only thing I would improve on is an option for a taller tripod for stand up target practice. I based my purchase on the reviews and experiences with Roxant's customer service dept from other purchasers and their sincere and intelligent responses. Instructions were very clear and the ease of use great. I am ex military and this scope fits my personal needs and works as advertised. I am also impressed with their customer service follow up on my purchase to ensure I am satisfied with their product. Abe B.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Birch

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Roxant Blackbird Spotting Scope. I am going to use it at the gun range to monitor targets at 100 yards. Also, going to use it to view deer in my backyard. Also, going to use it on the lake to view wildlife and other boats. I bought the Roxant instead of buying both a good pair of binoculars and a spotting scope. I really like the size and weight since I wanted something more portable that I could possibly take hunting. The price is outstanding since I was looking at a major sporting goods store for spotting scopes and their prices started approximately 700% higher for spotting scopes.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Best value
customer_reviews.text: The Roxant Blackbird sporting scope is pretty much perfect for my needs. I went out to the range and discovered their “nicer” (i.e. slightly more expensive) spotting scopes were not up to the task @ 100yrd. Went out and ordered the Blackbird when I got back home. It was a fraction of the price of what I had been using and it out performed it almost all the way around. The only issue that I have with the Blackbird is that the focal length requires that I remove my glasses to use it.
customer_reviews.author: SDMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected from Roxant
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this based on good reviews, plus I own Roxant's camera stabilizer & am impressed and happy with that product. Not so much with this scope. Clarity was soft at max zoom, the sun shade hood fit was extremely loose. It sort of rattled around as it was moved in & out. Same loose fit of the eye cup. No resistance to any contact. Too many issues to ask for resolution from Roxant. Returned & got the SVBONY 20-60 80mm for more money & love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Puzio

customer_reviews.title: Great spotting scope for lite weight packing into backpack hunting and camping! Great company to deal with
customer_reviews.text: Great small and lite spotting scope that I am taking elk hunting this fall. The size and weight and reviews led me to buy this scope for a pack in elk hunt this fall. Is clear and a great buy! Focus ring works smooth and customer service from roxant contacted me and asked how I liked the Blackbird spotting scope after I had a chance to try it! They were very nice and genuinely seem to care if you like their products! Asked if I had any ideas to make products better and gave some ideas to make even better! Would buy again!!!
customer_reviews.author: TAB/JWB

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this one over another competitor due to its size. It's small, light and overall feels sturdy and I don't believe I'll have any issues with it. Currently using it at the shooting range as well as for surveillance work. Everything feels fine, the rubber casing is a nice touch. I wasn't expecting such a great piece for the price, but it definitely surprised me. The tripod is actually pretty good, it isn't flimsy. Major brands or well known spotting scope/binocular companies are nearly 10 times the price but probably not 10 times the quality. I will use this often so time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.  Really nice scope and well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: A very nice piece of kit especially for the price. Well done. This will be used as a bird scope as well as a rifle range spotting scope. Really nice feel to the scope, the rubberized outside is easy to hold, it’s lightweight but doesn’t feel cheap at all. All mechanisms move very smoothly with the expected amount of pressure and seem to hold where you leave them nicely. Tripod feels sturdy and is good quality. I was initially skeptical of the tripod but it actually is nice. Optics are good, clear and crisp enough to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Ken A.

customer_reviews.title: the eye piece felt like and sounding like
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scope and a VisionKing 25-75x70. I focused on a flood light on the side of a church, about 100 yards away. In the same lighting conditions, and setting both scopes at full power- Roxant at 45 and VisionKing at 75- I could see the bolts that held the lamp holders on with the Roxant. At 75 power, the whole fixture was, no more than a dark dark shape with the VisionKing. That is the honest truth. I am returning the VisionKing. Cons of the Roxant; At around 30 x, the eye piece felt like and sounding like...they had poured a bucket of sand in it.
customer_reviews.author: bryan taylor

customer_reviews.title: small, so don't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have returned this product. I bought it to replace a spotting scope for archery. I have a Vanguard High Plains 560 15-45x60 Spotting Scope. At 50m, the Roxant just isn't strong enough (36x vs 45x) to resolve the target. In addition, the lens is significantly smaller in diameter (50mm vs 60mm, so lets in less light, so it is darker. On the positive side, it is VERY light and compact and seems to be rugged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance but 5 star Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I try to use this spotting scope to see the hits from a 44 mag at 100 yards. Well the 9x power scope on my rifle had better zoom and its just a cheap Cabela's 3x9 scope. I could not get it to fully forces in at 32x power. it was full sunny day and i was under cover so you rule weather out. I do not see how so reviewers could see a 22 cal hole at 100 yards. maybe its the luck of the drawl but the one I got was useless to put it nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great Scope
customer_reviews.text: I plan to use this to watch wildlife, and birds particularly. This is an excellent scope. I am a bit of a miser with money, and I do not regret for one minute purchasing this fine scope. This feels like an excellent piece of gear. I am very pleased. I am surprised that such a quality scope could be found at this price. The size is perfect, and it is not cumbersome in weight, but still feels incredibly sturdy. This has a solid build. The casing provides a protective feel to the scope, and the focus ring is quite smooth. The tripod is incredibly sturdy and I sincerely appreciate that it is metal. I feel this tripod could sell itself!
customer_reviews.author: Content Review

customer_reviews.title: ... received my Roxant Black Bird spotting Scope and absolutely love it. I have already used it for birding ...
customer_reviews.text: I received my Roxant Black Bird spotting Scope and absolutely love it. I have already used it for birding in my backyard and it’s so light and compact and easy to grip with the rubber coating. There is so much light and everything is so bright and clear especially looking at nature. I mostly have used it for target shooting up close and out to 100 yards checking my shots. I like the size and weight of the unit it fits in my range bag nice and neat and it comes with its on stand. I just wish the stand was a little adjustable in height but for the cost you really can't beat this spotting scope. Thanks Scott
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright image throughout the range of the zoom.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scope to use in my out-door archery. I shoot very skinny arrows with my compound bow at distances of 40-60 yards and this scope allows me to see in real time where my arrows are striking, so I can make sight adjustments as needed. I mounted it to my full-size camera tripod and the angle of the eyecup allows me to use the tripod at a lower height than an in-line scope would require (more stable). The view is bright, even when zoomed in all the way. The extendable sun shade reduces glare. All-in-all a good scope for the money.
customer_reviews.author: David J.

customer_reviews.title: Great specs and works well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this spotting scope as a gift for my sister- the reviews were great, and the optical specs were top notch. I liked the zoom range- it seemed appropriate for the aperture, and the low magnification was usable for handheld uses. The build quality was very good- everything moved smoothly, and the construction felt solid. I also liked that it had all the needed accessories, with a bag, tripod and lens caps. Overall, I was impressed by the scope- good optics and construction for a good price! My sister was also very happy with it and was comfortable using it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Robimus

customer_reviews.title: Good zeroing scope
customer_reviews.text: The Roxant Blackbird arrived a couple days ago and I am really impressed by the quality. For the price, I was not expecting too much. However, it seems to be of very solid construction. It is light, but solid. The construction seems to be very good. The zoom and focus are smooth and firm. They don't feel like a cheap gimmick like some optics I have used. I plan to use this scope for target practice for my 1945 Lee Enfield. This gun can shoot accurately up to 800 yards or so - and I think this scope will be helpful in zeroing it.
customer_reviews.author: Boston Bill

customer_reviews.title: Much more than I expected - great value
customer_reviews.text: Great product and I'm very happy with my purchase. Feels like it would cost plenty more. I've used it once and thought it was great. Primary usage is as a spotting scope for sighting in my rifles. Beyond that, I'm sure I'll come up with other use cases because of how well it worked out with sighting my rifles. Size, weight are both just fine. The size allows me to keep it in my gun bag without taking up much space. The focus ring is smooth and allows me to really dial it the focus well.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and compact streamlined design
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed by the camera style focus ring, which gives this scope a nice streamlined shape and makes it much easier to focus versus the small focus knob on the side that most spotting scopes have. The optics are top quality and provide a good image. That and the compact streamlined shape with the tactile rubber coating make it a nice little scope with the same magnification as a much larger and bulkier one I have (Meade). The tripod has somewhat spindly metal legs which I think would be better made of a strong plastic to prevent possible bending, but they do the job. All in all, I am very happy with the blackbird.
customer_reviews.author: Dave F

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for the price
customer_reviews.text: The Blackbird is a great compact size scope that I have been using on the shooting range together with a cellphone adapter, to monitor were the bullets are landing on the target. Is light to carry around, and I love the quality of the lenses and how smooth are the wheels to zoom and focus, I also love the feel (strong) of the rubber armor casing. I only have two suggestions, the tripod is ok, but could be much better. Also, no sure why the scope is only weatherproof and not water and fog proof, this is definitely missing on such a quality piece. Otherwise this is a great scope for the price and would definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ulyana S. Panchishin

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of glass for the price
customer_reviews.text: Size, weight, and sturdiness are very nice. I like the rubber coating. The magnification and focus rings are smooth with just enough resistance. I like that the tripod is metal instead of plastic, it’s sturdier and is still extremely lightweight. This would make a great gift for the price and the quality of the unit as a whole. Setup was easy, not sure that I would have ever known it had a sunshade if I hadn’t looked over the instructions. I think is a quality piece of glass for the price and I would recommend it to a friend. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Great Spotting Scope, Best Value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a very reasonable price. I am using the Blackbird Spotting Scope for hiking and raptor watching along with a spotting scope at the rifle range, The optics are very clear and adjustability for zoom and focus is fantastic. Looks like it is fairly rugged and I am hoping this product will serve me in the years to come. I am now looking at a pair of binoculars for my wife and will look at Roxant's products.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Nesler

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive all around scope.
customer_reviews.text: I’m really impressed with my new Blackbird spotting scope. The clarity is incredible, colors and detail very clear and sharp. I plan on using this scope for viewing our pastures, viewing birds, drives in the mountains, and whereever my travels might take me. This Blackbird scope feels good to hold and easy to focus and zoom. Works well with my glasses and feels well made. I liked the price and would make a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: J Foss

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tool For Shooting
customer_reviews.text: The Blackbird spotting scope is exactly what we need to check our consistency in the grouping at different yardage. It is easy to use, lightweight, stable and just an awesome piece of equipment to add to my practice for the department qualifications without having to walk 200,300,400 yards on a 95* day. I made a good choice buying this affordable and well-crafted spotter scope. With all the shooting I do throughout the year to keep my skill at 1/8-1/4 MOA @ 100 and 200 yards, this is the perfect tool.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my husband. He is delighted with it. We are living on a farm and are using it to watch and photograph the wildlife around us. We will also be using it while hiking. My husband was really impressed with the feel and the operation of the scope. We really feel like we got a good bargain; a good product for a good price. I think this is really a well built scope and the tripod works great. I'm thinking of buying another one to give to my brother. The zoom works smoothly and it is easy to focus. This company also truly provides caring customer service.
customer_reviews.author: LYDIA BANDHAUER

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, but I wouldn't have purchased it if ...
customer_reviews.text: It's okay, but I wouldn't have purchased it if I would have used it first. I wear glasses and the eye piece viewing area simply is too small to use with them on.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: If you need a scope this is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: have used this scope once at the range this week, wow! I am very happy I purchased this Roxant Black bird scope. The clarity was very sharp even at max zoom. I was not expecting it to be so light, I have red dot sights that weigh more than this. I could easily check my shot groups at 100yrds and 200 in small caliber. Haven’t tried larger caliber at greater distance yet as the local range maxes at 200yrd. Will definitely recommend to all my friends. Thanks again for having this available at such a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect range scope.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy. I like the scope, it is perfect for my needs The construction of the scope is very good. The tripod is good and feels steady and durable. I will use it for spotting on targets as well as long range spotting, it could be used for star gazing too. Set up: It was very easy really didn't need the instructions because of the simplicity I might purchase another as a gift or just to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Cailli

customer_reviews.title: Love the tough feel of the case
customer_reviews.text: So far I am thrilled with the Blackbird, especially the price. Just received my blackbird scope today. Initial reaction was it was a very high quality product. Extremely concise and well-made. Love the tough feel of the case, definitely not a toy. Though I cannot shoot today, I was-looking out my windows and could see up close the birds from 75 yards away. It was like they were right in front of me. The tripod though small ( but perfect for what I will use it for ) had a “heavy duty” feel to it. I was surprised how well it worked with my glasses, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Roxant Authentic HD spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well built spotting scope. Very compact with really good optics! Very good quality for the price. I really like the rubber armor coating. The metal tripod is so much better than plastic. Its a very solid unit, easy to use and to set up. We have bald eagles, deer, our cattle etc. to watch and this scope is perfect for that purpose. Buy it, you can't go wrong. It's well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Talk about Definition
customer_reviews.text: Wow, the true meaning of high definition and clarity. It is the perfect size for me. It fits in one hand and my range bag. Love It. I think it is the perfect size for my needs. Have not used the table top tripod yet. Using it at the range for target shooting. Priced very well. I honestly believe they could sell it for more. It is easy to use and very clear. The glass is simply amazing. I'm able to zoom in to my community mailbox and see the numbers on it. I couldn't believe how clear and crisp the image was.
customer_reviews.author: sydney hornbuckle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Target Spotting Scope
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this scope & love it. Straight out the box everything that comes with it (i.e. tripod, lens caps) is excellent. The scope was very simple to use & is exactly what I was looking for to use as a spotting scope for the gun / rifle ranges. I have used the scope to look at the moon & also to look at different objects from a distance. My future plan is to get a cell phone adapter in order to take photos. I definitely would recommend this scope to any of my friends & it would definitely make an excellent gift.This spotting scope is awesome! Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Richard S Enriquez

customer_reviews.title: Nice scope if you don't want to spend an arm and a leg.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this little scope for bird watching, here are my first impressions. Light weight! I mean if i'm going to lug it in the field to spot birds, I want light weight right? Pretty nice clarity, the images are nice and crisp. Field of view, not so great, it's a bit hard to find what i'm looking for due to a relatively small field of view. Mount to a tripod, only so so, so far i can't get the darn thing secured to the tripod, the screw loosens. Price, well here you go, the price is pretty good for a pretty good scope.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: Roxant Blackbird (cool name) personal review, Love the size and weight it feels very sturdy,it's compact​. I like the rubber armor coating although I've read reviews that say any rubber coating eventually turns gummy but that remains to be seen.The focus ring is smooth and it seems well built thru and thru.The tripod is nice and sturdy and a nice added feature to a quality low cost spotting scope. I use it at my rifle and pistol club and couldn't want for anything more.This thing would make a very nice gift to those of us with humble origins.The price was right, the reviews were right and I'm happy with it, what more could one say?
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality Scope
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scope for wildlife viewing. I plan on going to Yellowstone next year and hope to see some wolves and bears. I like the fact that i can attach my phone to it. Makes it really easier to use. I like the weight; it won't be a burden to carry. and the small size allows me to put it in my camera backpack without removing some of the lenses. The scope is a good value for the price. I will be taking the scope to caprock canyon in November for its first real test.
customer_reviews.author: Grambo

customer_reviews.title: Nice scope, but the focus ring is stiff
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot to like about this scope. The image is very clear bright and sharp. The size is very convenient. The added features are nice, eye cups, sun shade. The problem for me was the focus ring being very stiff. I like that it is on the barrel of the scope, but it is so stiff that I need to use two hands and will lose my position. This might not be a problem if you are viewing a fixed target, but for bird watching this will not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Terrien

customer_reviews.title: Great compact scope, excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a compact spotting scope and few days ago I got the Blackbird. So far, I find this scope absolutely faultless. When I compare it with my old one that I used for longer time I am so pleasant with my new one. It's really light weight and small size to carry around. The optics gives pure clarity. I would recommend a good tripod while zooming all the way up to 36x. I plan to use it for birdwatching and close-up looks at other wildlife. If you're in the market for a compact scope, I'd highly recommend this one. The Roxant Blackbird spotting scope is absolutely amazing especially in this price.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: Just received my scope. Have only had a chance to use it looking out in the back yard. I love the size of the scope...small but solid. All the controls seem to function very well, the view seems very crisp and it is easy to focus. I plan on using the scope mostly at the gun range, but I am sure I will using it for other purposes, such as, wildlife observation and some star gazing. The small size makes it easy to transport, meaning, I will keep it close at-hand.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great scope, great price!
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased by the quality of the Blackbird Spotting Scope and particularly the clear field of view with no distortion whatsoever, right through the highest power. I also liked the ease of zoom and focusing without having to change "eyepieces" or anything else. LOVE the "feel" and solid construction of both the scope and tripod. Will be getting another one for my shooting bench.
customer_reviews.author: William Henson

customer_reviews.title: Great Spotting & Wildlife Scope
customer_reviews.text: I just received my Roxant Blackbird Spotting Scope and am very pleased with the build quality and light weight. Also impressive are the optical clarity and ease of focusing. A pleasant surprise is the built in sun shade. I will find the Blackbird useful for wildlife observation & target spotting. This is my second Roxant product and therefore will be happy to recommend its product line.
customer_reviews.author: mns4n6

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price, but 36x?
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time today to help sight in a new SPR build at 200 yards. Glass seems good and focus is reasonably clear, especially at this price point. My only beef is the zoom rating. Next to my 4-16 rifle scope, I really don’t feel that max magnification is 36x. Maybe 24x tops. I don’t have a way to verify, but the rating seems optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 19

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: If you just want to look at birds in your backyard, or check your targets at 100 yards at the range, then this will work just fine. If you want to go much beyond 100 yards, I would suggest looking elsewhere. This is not a long range spotting scope. This combined with a smartphone mount will allow you to get some good backyard bird pictures. I, however, hoped that it would work for hunting, but I will be purchasing a different spotting scope for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for your 1st spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: I really like the size of this spotting scope. It is perfectly fitted in my small range bag. I used it in the indoor shooting range. It didn't take up a lot of counter space when I used it. I have tried to spot the shots in 50 yards target. It is clear and easy to use. The stand is very sturdy. Great price for a great product. Definitely, it is a wonderful gift for a beginner shooter. I haven't used it in outdoor shooting range yet. Not able to comment on how it performs outside and anything over 100 yards. I will come back to adjust my review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: Roxant Authentic Blackbird High Definition Spotting Scope. The only thing that would have made this a better deal was if it had a fine focus knob which would really be nice at the higher end of the zoom range. the table top tripod was actually much better than I expected and works very well. I paired this spotting scope with a Victiv 72-inch Camera Tripod Aluminum Monopod T72, which was an awesome tripod for the price
customer_reviews.author: Ichibahn

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Size is great! It is light and may give the impression of being not of high quality but quality is as good as all the higher priced scopes! Construction seems to be good. The focus and magnifier rings are tight and feel like good quality. Casing is fine and I imagine that is why it feels so light in weight. As stated above rings are tight and smooth. Tripod is a surprise as for the money it seems very stable. Plan to use it for sight seeing and focusing in on long distance. Price is extremely fair for the quality of the product!
customer_reviews.author: DG's

customer_reviews.title: NICE
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of gear for my hunting and sightseeing bag. It is a good quality piece of gear. Rubber casing is nice. Focus ring is smooth when using. Size is perfect. Weight is very good. Construction feels solid and sturdy. Price is why I bought it. As well as the favorable comments. Love it. Using it for target shooting, spotting, and sightseeing.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Works well at 50 feet for bullseye shooting
customer_reviews.text: The scope seems to be made from good quality materials. The rubber armor casing is of a good quality and adds to the appeal of the unit. Very easy to figure out if you follow the simple instructions. The tripod is similar to another that I have and works just fine. It would make a nice gift for someone needing a small practical scope.
customer_reviews.author: Brosky

customer_reviews.title: CAN,T BELIEVE THE QUALITY AND CLARITY FOR THE PRICE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I think for the price this is a great value. The focus is awesome-probably the feature I like the best as you can get amazing clarity.-the rubber coating is a nice touch too. I’m using the scope for spotting game-looking at wild life-star gazing-sporting events if I get a box seat-watching my neighbor lady swim at her pool (Joking)-looking for fish on the ocean possibly races like the tour de France and other bicycle races. The size of this scope is compact and easy to carry around with you for your adventures. As an added bonus this scope is made by a company in the U.S.A. that obviously values its customers. Probably going to purchase another one for my son.
customer_reviews.author: harold patterson

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Considering what you get for the price-point, there doesn't seem to be another spotting scope that can beat the Blackbird. It's nice and lightweight too. From what I can see, these guys aspire to have excellent customer service. I’ve used the scope at an indoor shooting range, and I've tested it out glassing the mountains from my office window (I work right near Wasatch National Forest in Salk Lake County). So far the scope has worked great. I intend to use it for all sorts of outdoor activities, including camping, hiking, and hunting.
customer_reviews.author: W. Pryce Thomas

customer_reviews.title: The Roxant Blackbird Spotting Scope is excellent for the shooting range!
customer_reviews.text: I received my Roxant Blackbird from Amazon yesterday and am very impressed. It's compact and easy to pack with my other gear when I go to the shooting range. The scope and tripod are very well built and sturdy. They definitely thought of everything when it comes to quality and features........dust covers for the lenses, carrying bag, velcro straps.......a lot of value for the money! The rubber armour casing, metal tripod, and the smooth adjustments are superb. Thorough intructions, a great warranty, and online support are outstanding! It's definitely a great gift for my birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of being a nuisance at the gun range without a spotting scope. I bought the blackbird because of the positive reviews online. My gun range only has the capability of 100 yard shooting. From what I have read the blackbird would be ideal for up to 200 yard target shooting. It seems I made a very good decision purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Steffen

customer_reviews.title: This works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought a monocular from Roxant and was really pleased with it. I saw the Blackbird spotting scope on their webpage. It has excellent reviews and is at a great price. When I received it the next day I couldn’t wait to check it out. But life intervened and I had to wait two weeks to try it out. It’s really nice. The tripod is better than I thought. The case is a heavy canvas material. The scope takes a few minutes to get the view how you want it. It’s clear, can focus near or far and is so easy to use. I’m going to get the phone attachment as it should work well to take pictures.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice spotting scope!
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very impressed. The build quality seems to be rather good to exceptional, as is its ease of use. In mere moments I was able to get it setup and honed in on multiple objectives with minimal adjustments. All mechanicals were smooth and intuitive, and the extensions for shade were an added bonus. I will be using primarily for target shooting, and will be recommending the Blackbird spotting scope to others.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for under $100.
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the value of the this spotting scope. I am using it to site 22LR targets at 100 yards. That seems an easy task for it. I intend to use it for 500 yard siting with my 6.5 tactical rifle soon. It has very clear optics. The movements seem smooth. The tripod is much better than I expected. It is certainly good enough for 100 yards but I may upgrade it for longer distances. For under $100 it matches the quality of other scopes multiple times that number. If you're looking for an adequate scope for normal shooting distances, I can't imagine there is one this good at this price level
customer_reviews.author: Bullitt

customer_reviews.title: Nice little scope!
customer_reviews.text: The Blackbird is a most wonderful scope. The controls are easy to use. The feel of the rubber housing makes you feel confident on its grip. I really like the size the best. It is light weight and easy very to carry. We were just going to use it with the tripod in our back yard, but because it is so easy to handle we plan on taking it on our hikes for bird watching. I am impressed with the quality of the Blackbird. It is much better than I imagined it would be for the price. They have made a winner and a customer out of me!
customer_reviews.author: William M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I noticed when sitting on my deck early every morning, that I saw many birds flitting about in the trees and remarked to my wife that I would like a spotting scope to look at them. So she ordered this product, and I have been able to view several different kinds of birds from my back deck. The spotting scope seems to perform well. I like the attached lens caps and the zoom capability. I like the mini tripod, but I do wish in came with a full size tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Mark V.Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that the Roxant Blackbird is both light weight and appears to be very durable. I plan to use mine at both at the rifle range for spotting and also in the field and seashore for watching wildlife. Objective acquisition is easy as is focus and magnification, I prefer the included metal tripod it is a much better option than some flimsy plastic item. Out of the box this unit was easy to set up and use with the included instructions. Thank you Roxant for producing a high quality affordable spotting scope, I would highly recommend this scope as a gift for outdoorsman/woman.
customer_reviews.author: William J McGovern

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: I had the opportunity to utilize this spotting scope while hunting in the New Mexico forest. The image seen in the scope was very clear and I was able to spot animals about a quarter mile away. I’m very pleased with my purchase. The scope is made very well with sturdy parts and a well made tripod. If you need a spotting scope to fit in your back pack for long trips then this is the right scope to buy.
customer_reviews.author: BirdMan80

customer_reviews.title: Really great scope particularly for the money
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my Blackbird scope, I use it on the shooting range to check my shot accuracy, as well as setting it up on my back deck to view wildlife. Very pleased with the quality and the tripod, very sturdy. Optics are very good and does a 1000yard zoom in without problem. Good product. Focus ring moves well and the zoom is great. Rubber casing seems like it is highly protective, but I haven't used it in the rain yet.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mullinix

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: The Black bird weighs less than expected. It feels like quality construction. The problems people had in their review All appear to have been remedied. Like a place for the tripod, the noise with adjusting. The tripod is sturdier than expected. I played with the scope a little on arrival could definitely see things hundreds of yards away. This is my first spotting scope. I feel I made a good choice. Can’t wait to go to the range.
customer_reviews.author: junk dude

customer_reviews.title: Ideal Scope for Short Range Shooting (up to 100 yards)
customer_reviews.text: The scope is super compact and overall it feels durable. I mounted it on the tripod immediately and really like how user-friendly all the controls are. Main purpose of this purchase will be for target shooting up to 100 yards and I’ll also find some other outdoor uses for the Blackbird as well. My favorite feature is how compact it is which will allow me to throw it in my larger range bag to bring to indoor ranges. The controls throughout the scope and bipod feel stiff in a good way so any adjustments need to be deliberate. Overall, I’m pleased with this purchase and feel that the Blackbird would make an awesome gift for my shooting buddies.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Met my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first spotter. Initially looked at more well known optics like Nikon, Vortex, etc.. I will be using this for wildlife viewing out our back window. I have it mounted on a large camera tripod, which is where it will stay most of the time. The image is clear with no blurring at the longest range. I am very happy with it and glad I saved the money over a more expensive unit.
customer_reviews.author: nsalle

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The Roxant Blackbird Spotting Scope is one of the best item I ordered thru Amazon Prime. The price is very reasonable compared to the big named telescope manufacturers. The armor rubber casing and the focusing rings are smooth to adjust and stayed focused. For such a light scope, it feels and looks like a solid, good quality and well constructed telescope. It was perfect for my bird watching and target shooting use. The tripod served well for me as well. I appreciate the fast delivery service.
customer_reviews.author: franky g

customer_reviews.title: Quality scope and outstandinf customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the size and light weight. The scope does feel well built. The armor casing is important because the scope will be going into the field with me. The focus is reasonably smooth. Many Amazon reviews of other scopes indicated the tripods were very flimsy. This metal one seems sturdy. The price was about the same as some higher power scopes on Amazon but the image quality rating was higher which makes it a good deal. Customer service is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: don_a

customer_reviews.title: Great solid  product
customer_reviews.text: The scope is light, compact and just what I was looking for.the finish is very nice and makes holding the scope very easy and slip resistant. The lenses are very clear and able to see detail out to 200 yards. The whole kit, scope and tripod are very solid and are now my go to scope for the range. Plan on also using it in conjunction with a phone adapter for long distance nature photography. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE C MESSAK

customer_reviews.title: no good as spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: I did not pay much and did not get much. A good spotting scope is going to cost $300+. Going cheapo did not work out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bigger isn't ALWAYS better.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I went with a higher quality glass that traded magnification for clarity. I do long distance shooting, and despite have 20X less magnification power than my last scope, it was actually easier to see where the shots were landing. Small, compact, powerful and clear. Great product, would easily buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: KeepingItFair

customer_reviews.title: It's lighter than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Got the Blackbird to get a closer look watching the bird feeder. It's lighter than I expected and I contemplate that it could an easy carry in a day pack in spite of its length. Appears to be rugged enough to transport given the rubber casing. Intuitively easy to learn how to use right out the box and quality-wise fits quite my expectations for being good at the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P. Rohane

customer_reviews.title: Great Scope!
customer_reviews.text: We do live Civil War artillery fire and this scope will be used to spot the fall of our shot at the match in April! I love this new scope! The affordable price, ease of use, small size, great optics all make for a satisfied customer! NEW INFO: We had the chance to use the scope at the Pelham artillery match in Tennessee this weekend. Was great! The photo of the view through the scope is focused on the 1000 meter targets. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Harry Titus

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely pleased with the Roxant Blackbird spotting scope. As I researched the different products Roxant Blackbird kept being mentioned. Happy with the smaller size scope for ease of handling. Attached lens caps are a bonus as they don't get lost. We have a waterfront home on Puget Sound so they're great to watch the marine traffic and activity from our deck. I highly recommend the Roxant Blackbird!
customer_reviews.author: Buzzy

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a Roxant mono scope last year and found it useful and handy while visiting several national parks. Based on that experience we ordered the Blackbird spotting scope and found it to be manufactured as well as the mono scope. We look forward to using it in our travels. We have used the Blackbird locally to spot some of our local birds and hawks and it is very convenient. We look forward to using the Roxant line of products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give a brief review of the Blackbird Spotting Scope. I have not taken it to the range as yet, but testing it in my neighborhood it was easy to use, easy to focus. The image is very clear, and the unit is compact and light. I would expect to pay more for this item as it has it all, tripod, and case.
customer_reviews.author: H. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the shooting range.
customer_reviews.text: I plan on using this at the range for 1 - 200 yard shoots. They optics are very clean and give me a crystal clear image. For the price I paid for it, I was pleasantly surprised at the build quality of the unit and the accessories that came with it. After all the research I've done on spotting scopes, there is no better deal at this price than the Roxant scope. If I had to do is all over again, I wouldn't hesitate to buy another
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: Price is great. It is extremely easy to figure out. Overall, I am happy with my purchase. Size and weight are fine and it feels fine, especially for the price. Focus ring is super smooth and the casing helps not to make noise on things I will be carrying. I use it for spotting animals The tripod is really the only thing I have a problem with on this entire product. It is not practical for any application I can think of, as you must be laying down to look through this scope assuming the tripod is also on the ground (which it will be for me)
customer_reviews.author: B. Britt

customer_reviews.title: Price and size get it 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: unpacked and set up my Blackbird yesterday. It is very well made; small, light and easy to use. I will be using it exclusively as a rane spotting scope, and am fully aware that it probably won't work to view targets past 100 yards. That said, I set it up to view a neighboring car well over 150 yards distant, and could easily read the license plate. This scope will be fine for any distances I will shoot, and it's simplicity is an asset.
customer_reviews.author: Spenser1

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: I have paid much more for scopes that weren't nearly as well made. Definitely on par with much more expensive spotting scopes. The rubber armor adds a substantial feel and gives good protection against minor bumps. Focus ring operates smoothly, the tripod is sturdy, made of metal rather than plastic. The optics are clear and sharp. Works great for sighting in new firearms (I build custom rifles), target shooting and hunting. Would work well for birdwatching, photography, surveying.
customer_reviews.author: Bud

customer_reviews.title: Good Scope For The Money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scope to be used in target shooting. I like the compact size and it appears to be well built. The large focus ring is easy to use and the included sun shade is a bonus. I would have preferred more eye relief but have gotten used to the scope's eye relief. All in all for the price it's a very fine scope.
customer_reviews.author: JS FL.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value - serves the purpose
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the range. Has sturdy construction, nice tripod, light-weight, nylon bag and dust covers keeps it clean. Excellent value for targets at 100 yards. No good at 200 yards, not enough magnification, focus is a little fuzzy, can't see the holes. A larger objective might help, not bright enough for cloudy or dawn/dusk conditions. For $80.00 US, no better value. 100 yards is good for sighting in new ammo, so serves my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde C. Helms

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace the binoculars I was using to sight in rifles at the local range. I've used it twice and so far, I'm impressed. It seems to match the the competition feature for feature at a far more reasonable price. The controls are intuitive and easily mastered and the magnification proved adequate for my ranges/purposes. It's compact enough to fit in my range box. I wish the tripod (included) fit in the case (also included), but the case has velcro straps on the outside to secure it, so it's hard to complain about that. The company seems customer-oriented and responds promptly to correspondence. I won't hesitate to order from them again.
customer_reviews.author: K. Nordlund

product_meta.title: Roxant Authentic Blackbird High Definition Spotting Scope with Zoom - Rubber Armor, Fully Multi-Coated Optical Glass Lens + BAK4 Prism. Includes Tripod & Case + Lifetime Replacement
product_meta.description: UNDERSTANDING OPTICS 101: Most newbies figure more powerful is better. When it comes to spotting scopes, more power is not necessarily better. Why? The larger the magnification, the more jitter, color distortion and loss of definition you will have. Better optics are the key. FACT: Although you may find similar scopes that advertise much higher magnifications, many of these claims are pointless. Magnification without definition is useless. Look for the best quality prisms and fully multi-coated lenses. Look for: retractable eyepiece (not fold down): for use with and without glasses, expandable sunshade for reducing sun glare, it’s not a common feature, but something you’ll wish you had. Some brands may LOOK similar, (you’ll find several copies online) but you’ll also find that these less expensive scopes use plastic connectors instead of metal. This becomes important when attaching your scope to a tripod. Plastic becomes stripped over time. Metal will last.The Blackbird features precision, premium military grade optics in a compact, very usable weatherproof scope. If you’ve tried our Grip Scope, then you’re familiar with our commitment to quality. Whether you enjoy the outdoors, or you’re involved with law enforcement or surveillance, this scope delivers. The compact, durable scope is versatile, convenient and extremely usable. You’ll enjoy crisp, pure color viewing with TRUE 12-36x50 ZOOM magnification. Our fully multi-coated lens and high-grade BAK4 prism guarantee super light transmission and brightness. A Large 50mm objective lens allows an optimal bright, clear view. 45 degree angled eyepiece is essential for comfortable viewing, unlike scopes with straight eyepieces which can be inconvenient for most viewing situations. For performance and value, the Blackbird is hard to beat. It packs light and delivers a punch. Field of view: 52-26M / 1000M / Dimensions: 232x135x78 mm / Exit pupil diameter: 4.1-1.4mm / MIN. FOCAL LENGTH: 8m
feature_bullets: ACCESSORIES INCLUDED - Compact Precision Spotting Scope With ZOOM 12-36x50 (Includes Premium Portable, Foldable, Handled Tripod and Carrying Case and Lens Caps) 45 Degree Angled Eyepiece Allows Practical Comfortable Viewing

WEATHERPROOF RUBBER ARMOR CONSTRUCTION - Rugged Non-Slip With A LARGE, "Smooth Glide" Textured Focus Ring ON the main barrel, (NOT a tiny separate knob above) + No Slip Comfort Molded Grip. Special Features - Extendable/Retractable Eyepiece For Use WITH Or WITHOUT Glasses + Extendable Sunshade Built Onto The Main Barrel To Reduce Glare. Large Objective Lens Allows Superior Light Transmission And A Bright WIDE View

PERFECT FOR NATURE - Wildlife, Outdoor Activities, Stargazing, Vacations, Hunting, Survival Training, Target Shooting, Bird Watching, Hiking, Camping, etc. Powerful Enough To Be Useful, Portable Enough To Be Convenient.

HIGH DEFINITION MILITARY GRADE OPTICS - Optical Glass With Superior BAK4 Prism and Fully Multi Coated All Glass Lens which guarantees superior light transmission and brightness for optimal crystal clear viewing even for law enforcement applications. Our scope with ANY standard tripod, But, one VERY IMPORTANT feature is our METAL mounting screw (not plastic like our competitors) This means your scope is SAFE and won’t accidentally snap off your tripod.

LIFETIME REPLACEMENT GUARANTEE - We’re A Small Family Company Based in the US. We Only Sell Products We Use Ourselves. We Completely Stand Behind Our Blackbird Scope. If You Have Any Questions or Issues, We Promise To Take Care Of You With Personal Service. You’re 100% Covered With Our Lifetime Replacement Guarantee. We're building our business one happy customer at a time.
